params.title: 📖 Tutorial: Digital Twin Basics
params.content:
🎓 Digital Twin Framework Tutorial

Learn by doing - 5 interactive lessons

📍 Lesson 1: Understanding State

The Windows 95 emulator maintains a complete state that includes:

  • Windows - All open windows with positions, sizes, content
  • Desktop Icons - Icon positions and organization
  • Taskbar - Start menu state, system tray time
  • Programs - Running applications and their data
✏️ Exercise: Open the browser console and run:
getLatestState()

You'll see the complete JSON representation of the current emulator state. This is what the digital twin captures!

✓ Lesson 1 Complete

📍 Lesson 2: Static Instructions

Instead of writing code, you define behavior as JSON. Each instruction file contains a series of steps that execute automatically.

Instruction Anatomy:
{
  "name": "my-workflow",
  "description": "What it does",
  "steps": [
    {
      "type": "createWindow",
      "params": { ... },
      "delay": 500
    }
  ]
}
✏️ Exercise: Run this in the console:
listInstructions()

You'll see all available instruction files. Each one is a complete workflow defined purely in JSON!

▶️ Continue to Next Lesson

params.title: 🧪 Practice Console
params.content:
🧪 Interactive Practice Area

This window helps you practice the commands you're learning. Try these:

// Capture current state
const state = getLatestState()
console.log(state)

// Execute an instruction
executeInstruction('cleanup-workspace')

// Run a data slosh cycle
slosh()

// Export state as JSON
exportState()
💡 Pro Tip:

Open your browser's Developer Console (F12) to run these commands. The digital twin system exposes a global API that you can use to control everything!

📚 Available APIs:

  • getLatestState()
  • exportState()
  • importState(json)
  • executeInstruction(name)
  • listInstructions()
  • slosh()
  • startSloshing()
  • stopSloshing()

params.title: 🎯 Quick Reference Card
params.content:
⚡ Quick Reference

📦 Core Concepts

  • Digital Twin - JSON that documents APIs
  • State Persistence - Auto-save to localStorage
  • Instructions - JSON workflows that run autonomously
  • Data Slosh - Bidirectional state flow

🔧 Supported Step Types

Window: createWindow, closeWindow, moveWindow, resizeWindow, minimizeAll, cascadeWindows, tileWindows
Desktop: organizeIcons
Feedback: notification, playSound
Advanced: executeScript, setTheme, wait

🚀 Next Steps

  1. Practice with the console commands
  2. Read existing instruction files
  3. Create your own instruction
  4. Share discoveries with others
